emuInput.TitMainTitle: Helen Tolliver and Leon Reis standing in front of Dr. Ralph Bunche display in Carnegie Library
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 21, 1950, pg. 1, reads: "Dr. Ralph Bunche Honored - Because of the heavy demand by library patrons for information concerning Dr. Ralph Bunche, Nobel Peace Prize winner for 1950, Carnegie Library recently erected a literary exhibit in honor of the distinguished career diplomat. Left to right: The Misses Leon Reis and Helen Tolliver, library clerks, view a series of articles about Dr. Bunche's, historic work at Rhodes, Dodecanese Islands, which were written by pg. L. Prattis, executive editor of The Courier, who was the only journalist present at Rhodes during the sessions.  The Courier donated the articles to the exhibit. - Harris Photo."
